reviewText: A seasoned lawyer and respected historian, Kent Masterson Brown pulls no punches in his perspective on the origins of the Confederate Battle Flag. The truth is, the St. Andrews cross flag has always been a symbol of independence, and defiance against tyranny.  He lays bare the grassroots story of the Battle Flag and how it symbolizes the South's assertion to individuate from the beloved, respected but errant North and carry on with the true mission of the Constitutional founders for soverign self-determination, states rights and freedom.
